Identification.LongTitle: An Act to implement certain provisions of the budget tabled in Parliament on February 27, 2018 and other measures

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Budget Implementation Act, 2018, No. 1.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Income Tax Act and to Related Legislation

Section.Text: Subparagraph (e)(v) of the definition eligible individual in section 122.6 of the Act, as enacted by subsection 28(1) of the Budget Implementation Act, 2016, No. 1, is deemed to have come into force on January 1, 2005.

Heading.TitleText: An Act to amend the Canada Pension Plan, the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board Act and the Income Tax Act

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Excise Act, 2001 (Tobacco Taxation) and to Related Legislation

Heading.Label: PART 3
Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Excise Act, 2001 (Cannabis Taxation), the Excise Tax Act and Other Related Texts

Subsection.Text: If Bill C-45, introduced in the 1st session of the 42nd Parliament and entitled the Cannabis Act (referred to in this section and section 118 as the “other Act”), receives royal assent, then for the purposes of this section and sections 117 and 118, commencement day means the day on which subsection 204(1) of the other Act comes into force.

If the other Act receives royal assent, then sections 69 to 78, subsection 79(1), section 84, subsection 85(2), sections 87, 89 to 106 and 108 to 113 and subsection 115(1) come into force on the first day on which both this Act and the other Act have received royal assent.

Despite subsection (2), if the other Act receives royal assent, then sections 158.02, 158.09 to 158.12, 158.15 and 158.16 of the Excise Act, 2001, as enacted by section 73, come into force on commencement day.

If the other Act receives royal assent, then subsection 79(2), sections 80 to 83, subsections 85(1) and (3), sections 86, 88, 107 and 114, subsection 115(2) and section 116 come into force on commencement day.

TitleText.XRefExternal: Regulations Respecting Excise Licences and Registrations
Regulations Respecting the Possession of Tobacco Products That Are Not Stamped
Stamping and Marking of Tobacco Products Regulations
Tobacco Products Labelling Regulations (Cigarettes and Little Cigars)

Heading.TitleText: Amendment to the Federal-Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act

TitleText.XRefExternal: Children of Deceased Veterans Education Assistance Act
Veterans Review and Appeal Board Act

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the provisions of this Part come into force on April 1, 2019.
Section 128, subsections 129(2) and (4) and sections 167 to 169 come into force on April 1, 2024.

Section.Text: The Greenhouse Gas Pollution Pricing Act, whose text is as follows and whose Schedules 1 to 4 are set out in Schedule 4 to this Act, is enacted:

Subsection.Text: The Fuel Charge Regulations, whose text is as follows and whose schedule is set out in Schedule 5 to this Act, are made:
The Fuel Charge Regulations, as made by subsection (1), are deemed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to have been made under section 166 of the Greenhouse Gas Pollution Pricing Act as enacted by section 186 of this Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of subsection 5(1) of the Statutory Instruments Act, to have been transmitted to the Clerk of the Privy Council for registration; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to have met the publication requirements of subsection 11(1) of the Statutory Instruments Act.

TitleText.XRefExternal: Environmental Violations Administrative Monetary Penalties Act

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), this Division comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.
Section 203, subsection 204(2), section 206 and subsections 211(1) and (3) to (5) come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 203, subsection 204(2), section 206 and subsections 211(1) and (3) to (5) in force April 30, 2020, see SI/2019-17; Division 2, other than section 203, subsection 204(2), section 206 and subsections 211(1) and (3) to (5) in force April 30, 2022, see SI/2019-17, as amended by SI/2020-36.]

Heading.Label: DIVISION 4
Heading.TitleText: Securities Issued or Guaranteed by Foreign Governments

Section.Text: Section 220 comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, which may not be earlier than the day — if ever — on which the United Kingdom ceases to be a member state of the European Union.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Section 220 in force January 31, 2020, see SI/2020-13.]

Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Payment Clearing and Settlement Act
Consequential Amendment to the Canadian Payments Act

Section.Text: This Subdivision comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subdivision A in force June 23, 2019, see SI/2019-48.]

Heading.TitleText: Amendments to the Payment Clearing and Settlement Act

Section.Text: This Subdivision, other than section 243, comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Subdivision B, other than section 243, in force June 23, 2019, see SI/2019-48.]

Heading.Label: DIVISION 9
Heading.TitleText: Canadian High Arctic Research Station and Application of an Order in Nunavut

TitleText.XRefExternal: Canadian High Arctic Research Station Act

Heading.TitleText: Application of an Order in Nunavut

Section.Text: Despite section 68 of the Northwest Territories Devolution Act, the Order entitled Game Declared in Danger of Becoming Extinct, C.R.C., c. 1236, is deemed to have continued in force and to have continued to apply in Nunavut, as of April 1, 2014.

TitleText.XRefExternal: Canadian Institutes of Health Research Act

Section.Text: This Division comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Subsection.Text: Any person who, immediately before the coming into force of this Division, occupied a position within the Canadian Cyber Incident Response Centre of the Department of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness or within the Security Operations Centre of Shared Services Canada, as of that coming into force, occupies their position within the Communications Security Establishment.

Nothing in subsection (1) is to be construed as affecting the status of such a person except that, as of the coming into force of this Division, the person occupies their position within the Communications Security Establishment.
For greater certainty, a person’s status includes whether or not they occupy a managerial or confidential position.

Section.MarginalNote: Information — Canadian Cyber Incident Response Centre

Subsection.Text: The Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness may disclose to the Communications Security Establishment information under the control of the Department of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness that is related to the Canadian Cyber Incident Response Centre.

The member of the Queen’s Privy Council for Canada designated to be the Minister for the purposes of the Shared Services Canada Act may disclose to the Communications Security Establishment information under the control of Shared Services Canada that is related to the Security Operations Centre.

Section.Text: This Division comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Division 12 in force October 1, 2018, see SI/2018-84.]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Department of Employment and Social Development Act

Section.Text: Subsections 270(1) and (2) come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.
This Division comes into force on August 12, 2018.

Heading.TitleText: Consequential Amendments to the Federal Courts Act

Section.Text: Section 300 comes into force on April 1, 2019.
The provisions of this Subdivision, other than subsections 310(2), 316(2), 324(2), 329(2) and 340(1), come into force on a day or days to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: The provisions of Subdivision A, other than subsections 310(2), 316(2), 324(2), 329(2) and 340(1), not in force.]

Section.Text: Sections 342 to 348 come into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Sections 342 to 348 in force September 25, 2023, see SI/2023-58.]

TitleText.XRefExternal: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Act

Section.MarginalNote: Subsection 114(2) of Canada Pension Plan does not apply

Subsection.Text: Subsection 114(2) of the Canada Pension Plan does not apply in respect of the amendments to that Act contained in this Division.

This Division, other than subsections 361(1) and (2), sections 365 and 371 and subsections 372(3), (5) and (6), 392(1), 399(2) and 401(3), comes into force, in accordance with subsection 114(4) of the Canada Pension Plan, on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Division 19, other than subsections 361(1) and (2), sections 365 and 371 and subsections 372(3), (5) and (6), 392(1), 399(2) and 401(3), in force December 15, 2018, see SI/2018-114.]

Heading.TitleText: Related Amendments to the Seized Property Management Act

Section.Text: This Division comes into force on the 90th day after the day on which this Act receives royal assent.
